The Slicube Format

Or how to create other slideshows like this one.

  • XML-based.
  • Four tags: presentation, cube, name, and face.

The opening tag

Simply presentation. It opens and closes the document. Easy, huh?

The cube tag

One for each cube. As easy as cube, with a child name with the name of that cube, and with six children face which represent each face.

Tip: To know the order of the face tags, the best way is "trial-and-error".

What's in the face?

Plain HTML. It's better when enclosed inside CDATA.

Only standards

  • HTML(5)
  • JavaScript
  • CSS3: animations, transitions, and CSS transforms.

The HTML5 part

The main difference, which allows it to be HTML5, is the fact that it has a doctype html tag. No canvas, or HTML5-specific tags (as far as I know).

JavaScript

Used to handle user interaction, basically. It parses the XML document, renders it, etc.

CSS3

To create the cubes (via 3D transforms), the fancy could-be-improved grid showing the slides, and style the document. Also, for the smooth transitions.
